channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16301] Trigger flush without waiting when compaction is disabled on a table
item.description:
When compaction is disabled on a table, flush needs to wait MemStoreFlusher#blockingWaitTime (default value is 90 seconds) before it goes ahead to flush. It has side effect that client may be blocked due to RegionTooBusyException. Please see the mail sent to dev list.

http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/hbase-dev/201607.mbox/%3C2D66B8CA-7C6F-40EA-A861-2DE5482EC7B2@cloudera.com%3E

I guess that the right behavior is to do flush without waiting if compaction is disabled on a table. Attached a patch.
item.summary: Trigger flush without waiting when compaction is disabled on a table

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Attach a patch with an unittest case

This message was automatically generated.
Can you add some assertion to testFlushWithTableCompactionDisabled ?
Thanks Ted Yu, I am revisiting to see if it is possible to add some assert.

Can you move this check to be inside isTooManyStoreFiles() 


region.getTableDesc().isCompactionEnabled()

Remove all commented-out code please: 


+    //TEST_UTIL.startMiniCluster(1);

Thanks Enis Soztutar for review. I thought about moving it inside isTooManyStoreFiles() when I first worked on the patch. But at that time, I thought that isTooManyStoreFiles() really means too many store files so aborted that idea. Looking at flushOneForGlobalPressure() again, it seems that it should be moved to isTooManyStoreFiles() to make the logic right as it really means flushable.

One minor improvement here is that for bestFlushableRegion and bestAnyRegion, they can be resolved in one loop and return a pair instead of two separate loops.

https://github.com/apache/hbase/blob/master/hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/MemStoreFlusher.java#L153


      Region bestFlushableRegion = getBiggestMemstoreRegion(regionsBySize, excludedRegions, true);

      // Find the biggest region, total, even if it might have too many flushes.

      Region bestAnyRegion = getBiggestMemstoreRegion(

          regionsBySize, excludedRegions, false);
Attach v2 patch addressing Enis and Ted's ccomments.

One minor improvement here is that for bestFlushableRegion and bestAnyRegion, they can be resolved in one loop and return a pair instead of two separate loops.

Seems orthogonal. We can do it in a different issue.
Yeah, a second thought, this may not make too much difference as I can imagine that the loop most breaks out in several iterations.
I have committed this. Thanks huaxiang sun for the patch.
Thanks Enis Soztutar for the review.
